summary: A Google Photos-like media storage and management app with 1000TB storage capacity. Features include photo/video upload, viewing, download, share, copy, multi-select, and file management.
architectural_notes: App is modeled after Google Photos with large-scale media storage (1000TB capacity)
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- PhotoVault app logo mark — a minimal camera aperture icon with soft gradient fill in teal and pink tones (photovault-logo.dim_128x128.png)
- Default placeholder thumbnail shown when a media file has no preview — a soft grey rectangle with a centered image icon (media-placeholder.dim_400x300.png)

existing_features.title: Redesign the app UI to look and feel like Google Photos: full-width responsive photo/video grid gallery, date-grouped sections, a top navigation bar with logo and search, and a bottom or side navigation for Albums, Library, and Explore views.
Support photo and video file uploads. When a file is selected, show an upload progress indicator. Display uploaded media as thumbnails in the gallery grid.
When a photo or video thumbnail is clicked, open a full-screen lightbox/modal viewer with navigation arrows (previous/next), the file name, date, and size displayed. Videos should be playable inline.

Add a multi-select mode to the gallery. When one or more items are selected, show a contextual action bar with Download, Share (copy shareable link), Copy, and Delete buttons that apply to all selected items.
Display a storage usage indicator (used vs. 1000 TB total) in the app, accessible from a settings or profile menu. Style it to match the Google Photos look.

Apply a clean, light Google Photos-inspired visual theme: white backgrounds, rounded cards, subtle shadows, the Roboto or similar sans-serif font, pink/teal accent colors, and smooth hover/transition animations on gallery items.

new_feature_requests.summary: Google Photos-like UI with photo/video gallery view
Download, share, copy, and multi-select file actions
Update the backend to store file metadata including file name, size, MIME type, upload timestamp, and a unique ID per user. Ensure the per-user quota is set to 1000 TB (1,000,000,000,000,000 bytes).
